remarks.para: May be inoperative in the GROUND position provided speed brake lever is not moved beyond the FLIGHT position during flight.

numlitem.para: Observe FLIGHT detent when speed brakes are used in flight.

note.para: If lever is inadvertently extended to the UP position in flight, aircraft will pitch nose-up, since the two outboard spoilers on each side (which do not deploy in FLIGHT detent) will be deployed.

placard.para: Placard near speedbrake lever: "OBSERVE FLT DETENT – SOLENOID INOP". Enter item in aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open P7 panel SPEEDBRAKE FLT DETENT circuit breaker.
If speed brake lever cannot be moved from DOWN to full UP position:
Remove ceiling panel 211E, forward of main entry door No. 1, approximately at the aircraft centerline.

Move solenoid or solenoid actuated lever lock to the relaxed “on the ground” position so that speed brake lever is free to move to full UP position. Remove solenoid (if required) and lockwire (if required).
